events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 26th Feb 2015 7:00pm
events.description: The UG leads of both Azure and Sgdotnet have gotten together to see if we can basically consolidate our events together, as our basic target audience are predominantly overlapping. For a start, we’re organizing UG events with speakers from both sides of the technology! Date: 26th FEB 2015 Venue: Level 22, Meeting Room, Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard Time: Generally starts at 7pm sharp. 1.Programming Windows on IoT Devices by Neng Giin Yap 2. Azure Mobile Services with Cross-Platform Mobile Development by Punit Ganshani (MVP) The topic will cover basics of Azure Mobile Services and the architecture. As a demo, we will also cover how to create Mobile services on the Azure, consume the service from the Mobile devices using Windows Phone or Android using Xamarin or PhoneGap. Please RSVP to confirm your registration and attendance by 25 Feb. 2015. ( http://azureugfeb2015.eventbrite.sg ) Note that there’s currently no email confirmation for the event. 10 Lucky winner will receive 2 full day pass to attend System Center Universe APAC Conference (Over 25 sessions). System Center Universe APAC Only 2 weeks for SCU APAC in Singapore, do you need free ticket…? if yes…. Follow the steps Step 1 like us https://www.facebook.com/systemcenteruniverse.apac Step 2 Join us http://azureugfeb2015.eventbrite.sg Step 3 Tell me 2 reasons to attend System Center Universe APAC? Winner will be announce on 26th Feb 2015 @ Microsoft Azure UG meeting
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.description: Hello everyone, We are group of people who think MeteorJS is awesome. We are planning our first Meetup of 2015. ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 Testing with Meteor (Shawn Lim) #2 Bulletproof Meteor and Hackathon experience (Xu MengXiang) #3 Open talks for any other Meteor projects #4 Socializing / Networking ==================================== We have some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Organizers: Tze Ken Lee , Cofounder & Director at InnoMonster Pte. Ltd. 5 years of experience in web development. Max Li Bin , Front-end Developer, 5 years of experience in web development. events.name: Drupal Global Training Day: Introduction to Drupal
events.description: Drupal Global Training Day is a worldwide training day designed to introduce people to the Drupal project. The aim of the Global Training Day is to bring a student from no-Drupal knowledge to a place where they can choose to be a developer, themer, designer, site architect, engineer, etc. During this 1 day workshop, we will be sharing with you fundamental Drupal concepts that are easy to understand. You will be equipped with best practices and tips that will help you become familiar with Drupal and use it for your next project. Come join us for an engaging day to meet your new friend, Drupal. And it's totally FREE!! :) Whom is the workshop for? Experienced web professionals who are interested in Drupal but have not started or don’t know where to start. Project managers, account servicing, front-end developers, visual designers who wants to know if Drupal is suitable for your next project. Anybody who is just enthusiastic about learning web technology! What will you learn? What is Drupal and why it matters Fundamentals of using Drupal How Drupal handles and manages content Common Drupal Terminologies Drupal file structure Commonly used modules to extend Drupal Drupal Themes and theming Drupal as a career for developer What do you need to know before coming? Familiar with building websites on a local environment eg. http://localhost will be extremely beneficial. Some basic understanding of what a common website is made up of, eg. web server (apache), HTML, CSS, Database (MySQL), PHP etc What to bring along? Your laptop, Windows / Mac / Linux Pen / Paper or Notepad to take down notes Drinking bottle (water is available for refill) An open mind to explore new things! About Presenter / Facilitator Joe Chin Joe has been a long time big Drupal fan. He has done so many projects with Drupal from personal website to professional. Joe is also very active in Drupal Community, and been presenting lots of talks in many Drupal events through out South East Asia. Pratomo Ardianto (Ardi) Ardi is senior web developer working at X-Team . He has years of experience working with Drupal, developing websites for start-up companies to corporates. Ardi is also very active in Drupal Community, and been giving few talks in Drupal Meetups and Drupal Camp Singapore. Got Questions? Feel free to post it in the comments below.
events.location: The Learning Centre@Waterloo, Blk 261, Waterloo Street, #02-27A Waterloo Centre, Singapore 180261

events.name: Welcome to Data savvy, Insight driven, Big Data Meetup on 27th February
events.description: Dear Big Data Enthusiast, Join Singapore Big Data Meetup on 27th February to learn the latest on Big Data and Analytics driven cutting edge insight, business intelligence and ROI. The Meetup discussions will have specific focus on Introduction to Enterprise Big Data Platform, Big Data Analytics Demo, Taming Streaming data. Technology and culture all need to be in place and working cohesively to maximize the return of big data and analytics. The only requirement is to RSVP and stay connected with Singapore Big Data community. Additionally, you may invite your friends, colleagues, customers to this Meetup Time: 27th February 2015 from 9 am to 12 noon Venue: TEC room, Level 1, 9 Changi Business Park Central 1, The IBM Place, Singapore[masked] Agenda: • 9 am to 9:30 am Registration • 9:30 am to 10 am Keynote by Anup Kumar on Introduction to Enterprise Big Data Platform - A quick overview of what are the various tools and capability available from IBM for taming Big Data . • 10 am to 10:30 am Big Data Analytics Demo - How to leverage BigR, BigSheet , BigSQL and other Hadoop technology to gain Insight from variety of data. • 10:30 am to 11:30 am Taming Streaming data - How to leverage various big data tools and capability to build application that require handling geo spatial, switch and sensors data. • 11:30 to 12 noon Tea Break/Networking
events.location: IBM Singapore, TEC room, Level 1, 9 Changi Business Park Central 1, The IBM Place, Singapore 486048

events.location: The Co 75 High Street

events.name: The emerging online threat landscape by @Eugene Teo
events.description: Targeted online attacks on software infrastructure were up 91 percent in 2013 and lasted an average of three times longer compared to 2012. Cybercriminals have become more patient and persistent — waiting for a bigger and better reward, and marking a shift in behaviour from years past. We have been actively keeping tabs on numerous highly resourceful and organised groups of hackers. Find out more about the evolving cyber risks and the devastating impact; and what it means for your tech company. Eugene Teo heads a multi-functional security team that he built from the ground up at Symantec. Prior to joining Symantec, he was a senior member of Red Hat's product security team where he played a pivotal role in investigating, reporting and managing security flaws reported in the Linux kernel. He was also a member of the upstream Linux kernel security team (kernel.org). His professional certifications include CISM, RHCE, RHCA, RHCSS, RHCDS, and RHCVA. He has been an active member of the Linux and open source community for over fifteen years. Eugene has spoken at numerous conferences, including Red Hat Summit, SyScAN, GNOME.Asia, and Linux Conference Australia.
events.location: Plug-In@Blk71

events.name: TGIFHacks #30 - Head First NoSQL
events.description: NoSQL is not a lie! There are a bunch of great NoSQL database technologies today. This TGIFHacks could probably be your first NoSQL tutorial. We will explore different categories of state-of-art NoSQL databases together (hands-on sessions included!). This TGIFHack will be conducted by Zhou Xinzi, who is the Technical Vice President of the club. See you all this Friday!
events.location: TR+37

events.name: WebRTC hackathon with the pros
events.description: We're very excited to host our first WebRTC hackathon in Singapore and get all our work around the Skylink platform into your hands. The good people of JFDI are so kind to host us for the entire Saturday, provide WiFi, coffee and lunch so you can spend the day learning about WebRTC with the team of the worlds technology leading WebRTC company Temasys. We'll show you around all our recent work and what it can do to bring embedded audio/video and data real-time communication into your app or website. So, if you're a web, iOS or Android developer and you'd like to hack around with WebRTC, come by! The Temasys team will judge the best work in the evening and we'll give out swanky prices to the winners! We'll max out at ~30 people, so be fast! To get you warmed up, here is Thomas' most recent talk about WebRTC and Skylink. Find the slides here: http://www.slideshare.net/serrynaimo/a-jquery-for-webrtc https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x2IHJBp2TTo Checkout http://skylink.io for more
events.location: JFDI Asia, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-16, Singapore

events.name: Coding Dojo: Legacy Code (C# and Java)
events.description: Want to increase your fluency on working with legacy code and don't mind sweating over it? You are probably in the right place. Registration RSVP yes if you can commit that whole afternoon to code and answered yes on the 4 prerequisites below. Four Prerequisites 1. Read the book Working Effectively with Legacy Code or otherwise, read a short article about it. 2. Already understood why writing automated unit tests and Test-Driven Development is beneficial. 3. Have experience working in Java, C# or other similar Object-Oriented programming language 4. Able to attend from 1:00pm to 5:00pm *** Do not need to rsvp if you are just coming to observe during that time. *** Background Have you experienced codes that are hard to understand and is brittle? How do you deal with that more effectively? We're going to spend four solid afternoon hours to practice how to work more effectively with legacy code by having coding dojo with the Trivia Game. This code kata is used in Legacy Code Retreat and you can find the source codes here github.com/jbrains/trivia . At the end, the legacy code should become cleaner and easier to understand. A lot of the methods used will be based on Michael Feathers' Working Effectively with Legacy Code . We will spend most of the time experimenting different strategies and see how it affect the code readability and design. How does it work? • Coding dojo randori • 2 groups of 6-8 people size of different programming language. • at the end of the day, do the Code Retreat Closing Circle: gather everyone together in a circle, then go one by one sharing something about the day What legacy code do we work on? https://github.com/agilesingapore/coding_dojo_legacy_code
events.location: Odd-e Singapore - Goodland Building, 18 Roberts Lane, #05-01

events.name: SG Geek Girls Maker Series: Revival of Mechanical Arts in the Maker movement
events.description: Welcome to the first Singapore Geek Girls event of 2015! The Maker series highlights women in the technology who are passionate about building and sharing their work. We kick off the year by inviting Denisa Kera, Associate Prof at NUS, who is an integral part of the Maker Movement in Asia to talk about her personal journey through various DIY, maker and hacker communities around the world, which transformed her from a philosopher to designer. Join her in the first SG Geek Girls Makers Series to discuss projects in open science, traditional crafts and art.

events.name: .NET Developers March Meetup
events.description: Hi .NETers, We would like to invite you all to the .NET Developers Community March 2015 Meetup. For this meetup we will talk, learn and share several topics. Here is the list of topics: • Secure Client-Server code . Lawrence is a 40+ IT Pro expert. He have some a series of client and server implementations that work up step-wise from a very simple "send a message and get a reply" to supporting TLS (1.0, 1.1 and 1.2), with and without strong client authentication, username/password authentication using really strong password hashing and salting, etc. All in C#.Net - Lawrence Hughes • Basic ASP.NET MVC for beginner . From start project up to deployment. - Dawa Law • Windows Universal App , let's make an app for Windows 8.1 , Windows Phone 8.1 and Android . - Punit Ganshani [Microsoft MVP on .NET] • S mart auto complete in WPF . Have you ever wondering what you will get when you type a keyword in a combo box or text box with auto complete? Well, you always do coding for thelist that you may aleady knew,but what if you don't know the list? I will share on some simple codes that can make the auto complete or search text box smarter than just sorting contains what you type. - Riza • How to use Azure SQL Database using .NET the right way. Using SqlConnection is good but when you need a reliable connection to Azure SQL Database or SQL Server running in a cloud environment such as in Azure Virtual Machine, you may want to be fast connected, insures connection and reliable. - Riza Let's meetup, enjoy, relax and have fun together. Btw, please send me some community jokes. :) WiFi : Available (free) Food : Available (thanks to Microsoft Singapore) Door Prize : Yes..!!! Five $10 Starbucks Card for 5 (five) lucky members from personal sponsor (not Microsoft). To participate : Members must already have Microsoft Azure accounts and answer one question regarding .NET or Azure.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Big Data for Social Good Challenge (See Details for Start/End)
events.description: THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE BEGINS NOVEMBER 10, 2014 AND CONTINUES TO MARCH 3, 2015. CALLING ALL DEVELOPERS .... JOIN THE BIG DATA FOR SOCIAL GOOD CHALLENGE Big data exists in just about everything we use and do. It comes from phones, cars, roads, power lines, waterways, food crates, and innumerable other items you’d never think of as computers. This data speaks volumes about our collective behavior and society – so let’s use it to do something incredible! IBM invites developers and data enthusiasts to take a deep dive into real world civic issues using big data and the IBM Bluemix Analytics for Hadoop service . Analyze one of our curated datasets or bring your own (provided it meets these requirements)! Use Hadoop and your data to create a clickable and interactive data visualization to highlight insights that you’ve found. Ready to get started? $40,000 in prizes will be awarded.... Register here: http://ibmhadoop.challengepost.com/ What to Create: Participants must create a working, clickable, and interactive data visualization utilizing the Analytics for Hadoop service on IBM Bluemix. Data Requirements: Your data visualization must analyze one or more datasets included in the curated list of datasets on the Data page OR meet the data size, content, and licensing requirements described on the Data page . The total size of the Datasets analyzed must be between 500MB - 7GB in size. Check out the requirements then go get your IBM Bluemix extended promo code and check out the datasets !
events.location: Big Data for Social Good Challenge, Web only, Singapore

events.name: Workshop: Building your 1st Kanban board
events.description: Building your first Kanban board can be very daunting. We'll make it more approachable and easy for you! You may have heard about this thing called Kanban or you have have a friend or colleague who told you about it. And it may (or may not) sounds easy to implement at first. But how do you actually go about it? This workshop will give you an easy approach to start your first Kanban board! There won't be much theory (although I'll give pointers if you want them) - the central theme of this meetup is DOING! Sign up if you are interested in learning more about how to achieve outcomes and metrics that matter.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, 22nd Floor, One Marina Boulevard, NTUC Cebtre

events.name: Public Talk: Window 8’s evolving developments
events.description:
SYNOPSIS: 
Information Technology has been rapidly evolving over the years with new developments in the creation of hardware and software solutions for various applications. In today’s IT scenario, new devices and technologies emerge every now and then. While computers in the form of laptops and smart devices have become an essential part of our daily lives, be it for work, entertainment or creativity. With new developments in technologies, developers have a greater challenge to provide support for multiple product platforms to meet the needs of the end users and the usage scenarios of a program. In this context, a need for convenient and universal Application Programming Interface (API) becomes more desirable and relevant. 
This talk will cover the new features offered by Microsoft for a developer that contains innovative interface system of contracts and extensions usage of the platform programs and their possible interaction with files and Application Programming Interface (API). 
COME AND FIND OUT MORE! 
Date:     9th March 2015 (Monday) 
Time:     7.00 pm – 8.30 pm 
Venue:   Lecturer Theatre, City Campus 
   250, Middle Road 
   Singapore 188983 
Speaker: Mr. Mikhail Gospodarikov 
  
SPEAKER PROFILE: 
Having started his interest in IT & Web Development since 11 years old, Mikhail Gospodarikov is a published speaker with years of experience in programming. He started his IT career with web development and he eventually learnt IT administration and networking. He won a grand-prix and a golden insignia in 2013 for his acclaimed application development for Windows 8 operating software. 
Register with us at 6690 9599 / 6671 2799 or events@tmc.edu.sg by 27th February 2015 to secure your seat. Hurry! Seats are limited. 
  
Don't miss out on this opportunity and bring your friends along. Click http://www.tmc.edu.sg/index.php/component/k2/item/286 for details.
events.location: TMC Academy, Lecture Theatre, 250 Middle Rd, Singapore 188983

events.name: Lets meet at Big Data Conference in Singapore
events.description: Big Data conference is a platform for Singapore leading analytic and business intelligence leaders to address the challenges and tap on the opportunities in leveraging Big Data in this unique market. It is a marketplace for the regional business leaders and IT executives to access the very best of ideas & technologies in adopting and improving big data and analytic practices and strategies. Theme: Driving Business Success KeyNote - Erick Stephens- Chief Technology Officer -APAC , Microsoft Big Data Conference focus on:- -Best of Both Worlds: Scott Morris, Vice President Asia Pacific and Japan, Simplivity Corp Read more Benefits of attending - This event concentrates on practical applications and exploitation of big data. - It aims to cut through the marketing hype and help participants understand - The pro's and con's of the new and powerful analytic tools (both open source and proprietary) - security & governance issues and special areas of application - Emerging challenges for CIO’s and information professionals. - What are the skills set required? Why Implement Big Data? Big Data - Accelerate your business - Re-develop your products - Perform risk analysis - Keeping your data safe - Create new revenue streams - Customize your website in real time - Reducing maintenance costs - Offering enterprise-wide insights For more detail click here Registration fee for conference Early bird fee: USD $600 For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee
events.location: Village Hotel Changi,  1 Netheravon Road Singapore 508502

Please reach out to event organiser Pieter if you'd like to share something about your app, service, startup, device, new feature, idea, or experience you're working on: [masked] Make sure to come early, not just for the free drinks, but also to be one of the lucky 50 Product Hunters to receive a FREE 46 page hardcopy of The Product Hunt Manual by @KikiSchirr worth $6.99 ! The Product Hunt Manual is an incredibly helpful ebook that shows you how to maximise your performance on Product Hunt by leveraging your network.

events.name: Lets meet at Cloud Conference in Singapore
events.description: Cloud computing continues to be the way of the future and many studies indicate that more than 50% of all information technology will be in this new paradigm within the next five to ten years. This transformation has great implications for emerging markets which have the potential to leap frog mature markets in their adoption of cloud computing, combine cloud computing and mobile technologies to introduce unique services that can transform the lives of billions, drive a much larger scale of adoption and challenge existing price points, while presenting unique challenges in areas such as security and user interfaces to cloud computing. Theme : Cloud Computing: Opportunities, Issues, and Challenges & Big Data Innovation: Driving Business Success. KeyNote - Erick Stephens- Chief Technology Officer -APAC , Microsoft Key Topics - Worksop on Cloud Platforms -Karthikeyan Rajasekharan , Technical Architect, Cloud Platform, Asia, Google Benefits of attending • Increased speed in responding to unforeseen events. • Easy to get the latest and greatest updates. • Adoption is quick and simple. • Improved information security. • Deployment time decreases from years to months. Audience for the Conference 2014 (Not limited to) Heads of Business Development, Strategy Directors, Directors, Telecommunication Managers, Communication Directors, Heads of Sales, Heads of Call and Contact Managers, VPs of Technology, Product Managers, Business Development Managers, Storage Managers, Business Analysts For More detail click here Registration fee for conference Early bird fee: USD $600 For online registration click here For offline registration, please send the following details to [masked] Name | Email ID | Contact No | Designation | Organization Name For this meet up group 10% discount on registration fee
events.location: Village Hotel Changi,  1 Netheravon Road Singapore 508502

events.name: Shaping the Future: Inside the Creative Mind
events.description: Wednesday 11th March 2015 2:30pm to 5:30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE Shaping the Future: Inside the Creative Mind What is creativity and what role does it play in today’s increasingly homogenized world? Six leading practitioners of their respective crafts will gather to share their unique perspectives in an afternoon of illuminating insights and discussion. This is an event organized by the British Council and ArtScience Museum, and curated by Pomeroy Studio. The session will be hosted by Eco-architect, Professor Jason Pomeroy and speakers include: • Andrew Grant, Grants Association • Jonathan Schütz, Award Winning TV director • Stephen Pimbley, Founder of SPARK Architects • Professor Anthony Bowne, Principal of Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music & Dance • Tim Ross-Watson, Celebrity Chef Please go to http://peatix.com/event/75938 to register for this event.

events.name: Lightning Developer Week 2015
events.description: 100+ Salesforce Developer, User, and Non-Profit groups across the globe will be meeting during Lightning Week to experience first hand the power of Salesforce1 Lightning. Join this meetup near you for demos, training, and to meet Salesforce experts. No matter your experience level you'll learn new tools that you can start using right away. Salesforce1 Lightning is a ground-breaking release of the platform that lets anyone build apps, fast and easy. Lightning does this by delivering a component framework and a new set of tools for developers and business analysts to make building apps, integrating data, and automating business processes lightning fast. We want everyone to get a chance to get hands-on with Lightning. So to make this happen, we are thrilled to announce Lightning Developer Week – a week of meetups around the world starting March 9th. Be sure to RSVP, slots are limited ! Attendees will get an exclusive limited-edition t-shirt while supplies last. Nick Tran, Senior Director, Developer Marketing would be our special guest and is traveling from California for this event. Bring your notebooks as well !! Dinner is on the house.
events.location: Cliftons Singapore , Level 11, Finexis Building 108 Robinson Road

About Blu Jaz Cafe • http://www.blujazcafe.net • Serves beer, wine, and additional finger food • If a lot of people sign up, we will reserve the 2nd floor Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia

events.name: FOSSASIA Social Event at Labrador Seaside View BBQ
events.description: Let’s get together with speakers and attendees of FOSSASIA 2015 at Labrador Seaside View BBQ! We will have four superb cuisine chefs who are known for their delicious BBQ food creations. Different meat, vegetarian and vegan options are available. Typical Singaporean beverages are served during the party. Of course there will be music and like in previous years we hope to see some international dance performances of our participants from around the world! The beautiful Labrador park is our perfect location to enjoy the friendly company of FOSSASIA participants at the seaside. Get a ticket here ! Date: Friday, March 13 Time: 6.45PM Location: Labrador Park Seaside View BBQ Directions: Public Transport: Labrador Park Station - Circle Line Station | Drive: 12~15 min drive, or 5 stops/10 min MRT (+ 10 min walk) Please get a ticket for the social event at: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com About Labrador Park The park is a hidden gem and an unusual historical relic in otherwise ultra-modern Singapore located right at the seaside. First developed in the mid-19th century as Fort Pasir Panjang, the fortifications in today’s Labrador Park were later renamed the Labrador Battery in the 1930s as the British Army prepared for a possible Japanese invasion. More Info on TA and Wikipedia . Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia Tickets: http://fossasia.eventbrite.com Labrador Park Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Labrador_Nature_Reserve
events.location: Labrador Park MRT (CC27) Station Control, Labrador Park, Singapore

events.name: Meetup and Get Certified by the Linux Foundation at FOSSASIA
events.description: Join us for a Linux Foundation meetup and get certified as the Linux Engineer (LFCE) or the Linux System Administrator (LFCS) at FOSSASIA in Singapore for a special one-time discount of 100 USD off usual rates in cooperation with OlinData . We'll have a dedicated room on Saturday March 14, 2015 at Blk71 where you can sit down in all quietness and take the examination so you can walk away with one of the highest quality Linux Certification in the industry. Click here to sign up . A Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator (LFCS) has the skills to do basic to intermediate system administration from the command-line for systems running Linux. Linux Foundation Certified System Administrators are knowledgeable in the operational support of Linux systems and services. They are responsible for first line troubleshooting and analysis, and decide when to escalate issues to engineering teams. More information here: training.linuxfoundation.org/certification/lfcs Online Self-Paced Course : If you want to make sure you are prepared for the LFCS exam we have a great deal for you: By taking a special edition of the online self-paced course for the LFCS certification, you'll be well prepared for the LFCS certification and at the same time supporting FOSSASIA. Please go here to proceed. A Linux Foundation Certified Engineer (LFCE) possesses a wider range and greater depth of skills than the Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator (LFCS). Linux Foundation Certified Engineers are responsible for the design and implementation of system architecture. They provide an escalation path and serve as Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) for the next generation of system administration professionals. More information here: http://training.linuxfoundation.org/certification/lfcs Links FOSSASIA: http://fossasia.org Twitter: https://twitter.com/fossasia Certification: http://fossasia.org/linux
events.location: NUS Plug-In@Blk71, Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-16, Singapore

events.name: Paper Crafting
events.description: Participants will learn about paper craft. Using techniques such as quilling and beadmaking, participants with learn how to fashion jewellery out of paper and other everyday materials
events.location: Toa Payoh Hdb Hub

events.name: Build your own distro with Lubuntu's Julien Lavergne
events.description: How useful would it be to give your customers a ready configured OS, that suits their needs right away? Or just how cool would it be to create your own OS for fun? Julien Lavergne Lubuntu maintainer will show us how to create your own distro based on Lubuntu. In the workshop you will learn several ways to to create a distro with different tools. We will show you how to start work from different base systems or distributions. You will learn about what choices are available for different use cases and how you can adapt your distribution for a specific country or for a specific showcase with your own applications. About Julien Lavergne Julien is a contributor in Ubuntu and Debian for 10 years. He is a Debian maintainer and an Ubuntu developer mainly working on the Lubuntu project as the main developer. https://gilir.wordpress.com | http://twitter.com/gilir Links Lubuntu: http://lubuntu.net FOSSASIA http://fossasia.org Twitter http://twitter.com/fossasia
events.location: NUS Plug-In@Blk71, Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-16, Singapore

events.name: Smart Nation API coLAB - API Launchpad
events.description:
Padang & Co, together with DEXTRA, is bringing you a whole week of APIs at the Smart Nation API coLAB!  
APIs are redefining how companies and individuals share information with each other, opening up vast sources of rich data and creating new (and significant) sources of revenue for businesses. What's not to like about that?  
Join us from 15 to 21 March for an immersive, hands-on experience that will leave you primed and ready to ride the API economy wave. Here's what we've got in store for you:   
API Launchpad - Sunday, 15 March 
 Kick-off the week at the API Launchpad where you will understand the opportunitiies available for APIs and learn about the latent business value waiting to be unlocked here. Key players paving the API economy, Intel Mashery and Accenture, will be talking about the future of APIs and what this means for businesses and individuals.   
Themed API Nights - Monday to Thursday, 16 to 19 March 
This series of themed workshops will enable you to dive deep into industries, such as healthcare, port and finance, to about just some of the ways APIs can be used. Hear from both public and private API owners about their APIs through case studies. You will also get to network with partners and fellow like-minded participants to start thinking about what you want to work on at the Hack Day.   
Hack Day - Saturday 21 March 
The Hack Day is your platform to experiment with over 100 APIs availabe for you to play with. 'Wow' us with your hacks at the show & tell session and win prizes up to $2,000 cash! Don't forget to stay on for the party afterwards! 
 API Launchpad Programme  
3.00pm - Welcome 
3.15pm - Smart Nation, the API Economy, and unlocking business value through APIs 
4.30pm - Technical Workshop 
6.00pm - Networking and drinks   
More Information 
To find out more about the coLAB visit: http://www.upsingapore.com/smart-nation-api-colab. Got any questions? Want to know how you can share your API at the coLAB? Drop us an email.
events.location: 237 South Bridge Rd, 237 S Bridge Rd, Singapore 058786

events.name: Make 'n' Speak Hackathon
events.description: In this unique camp, co-organized by Science Centre and Kidz Parade magazine, children (10-12 years) learn to propose and build solutions for a sustainable life and learn how learn how technologies can be used to develop smart solutions. Children also learn to communicate about their projects, participate in discussions and write about their work for a chance to get published! This is a day camp, 10am-4pm. Lunch will be provide
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Front End TL;DR March 2015
events.description: Let's visit migme, a startup that has been around forever and is currently reinventing itself as a social entertainment destination, complete with IPO and fresh funding from Foxconn last year. Come to learn about the host company but more importantly to learn front end tech technology. FEDS aims to showcase startups doing cool front end work, but also to sharpen our skills. We will split up into small teams, pick a topic of interest (e.g. library, framework, tool) and collaborate on it for an hour or so. Then present our findings for the common good, and the most interesting team wins a fabulous prize! Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.
events.location: Migme Hq

events.name: Papers We Love SG #007
events.description: Paper #1 - "Designing a dataflow processor using C λ aSH" - Anja Niedermeier, Rinse Wester, Kenneth Rovers, Christiaan Baaij, Jan Kuper, Gerard Smith :: (Michał J Gajda) Paper #2 - "Measuring Cognitive Abilities of Machines, Humans and Non-Human Animals in a Unified Way: towards Universal Psychometrics" - J Hernández-Orallo :: (Vikram Verma) ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG

events.name: Making with Cardboard
events.description: Strong furniture can be made out of cardboard. The programme will go through the basics of making cardboard furniture using “free form” design and everyday materials. Participants will also be introduced to 3D modelling of furniture and how to convert their models into printable pdfs which can then be used in the building of cardboard furniture
events.location: Toa Payoh Hdb Hub

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm 2015:time:space: By Robert Casteels 8pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 2015:time:space: is a collaborative work of voices, electronic instruments, live processing, tape and video. New electronic instruments are altered in real time, fusing effortlessly with the human voice. Projected against this kaleidoscope of sound will be stunning pre-recorded images of Singapore, tying in sounds from humanity to the technology of our modern world, crossing time and space. 2015:time:space: is an original production that is generously supported by the National Arts Council. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis. The full line-up of ArtScience Late until March 2015 can be viewed here: http://bit.ly/artsciencelate
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.description: Get your hands dirty as you make your own toys and games. Make glowing crystals, crane mechanisms, origami toys and much more

events.name: Interactive Community Security & Data Panel Q&A!
events.description: Edit: TIME AND DATE CHANGE: Due to scheduling we moved this to April 9th!! PANELISTS: - Eric Meyer (CEO and founder @ Apvera) - Dr. NG Wee Keong (Associate Chair @ NTU School of Computer Engineering) - Gary Lim (Chief Security Advisor @ Microsoft Cybercrime Satellite Center) **More to be TBA! TOPICS / TALKING POINTS Innovation in Singapore • Cyber Security on enterprises applications, Wearables and IoT. WORKPLACE CHALLENGES • Data Privacy • Using IoT in the workplace • Zero Day • Behavioral Sciences • Machine learning and AI FUTURE OUTLOOK • How the future will be shaped MESSAGE: Hi folks, I am going to kickoff this group with an Event to involve the community, and a panel discussion is the front runner. More information to be confirmed along the way. So far I do have 2 sponsors for this event, our friends at Microsoft and Apvera. And a few panelist from those respected companies as well, If anyone would like to participate as a panelist please reach out to me. Hope to see everyone there! Free shirts and food by the way so snack and meet new people! Thanks! Paul
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: AWS Essentials - Singapore
events.description:
AWS Essentials 
This training introduces AWS products, services, and common solutions with immersive exercises and hands-on activities. It helps learners who do not come from a technical background to gain proficiency in Amazon Web Services and empowers them to make informed decisions about IT solutions based on business requirements. 
Bring Your Own Device 
Please note that this class requires you to bring your own device. Plan to come to class with the following: 

A notebook computer with Wi-Fi (labs cannot be completed on an iPad or tablet device)
Administrator access to the computer, if Windows
Chrome, Firefox, or Safari (IE not supported)

Delivery Method - Instructor-Led Training (ILT) 
Duration - 1 Day 
Course Objectives 
By the end of this course, you will be able to: 

Identify AWS user groups and online tools and resources available
Create an AWS account
Identify technical terminology and concepts as they relate to the cloud and AWS platform
Describe key AWS Compute and Storage products and services, including EC2, EC2 Security, related application services and CloudFormation templates, VPC, Amazon storage gateway and lifting, storage on S3 and Glacier
Describe key AWS Scale and Networking products and services, including ELB, Auto Scale, CloudWatch metrics and alarms, Elastic BeanStalk , Networking with VPC, DirectConnect, Amazon Route 53, and CloudFront
Describe the impact and importance of Architecture
Identify the related Application services and CloudFormation templates
Demonstrate how to launch and manage server instances in the AWS cloud
Construct a hosted static website
Deploying Infrastructure and Applications
Describe the account, billing (tagging), pricing credentials delegation, reporting

Prerequisites 

None

Hands On 

This 1-day training gives step-by-step instructions, provides for exploratory learning and self-discovery with learning exercise and real world scenarios.

Course Outline 

Module 1: AWS Learning Resources & Getting Started
Module 2: Introduction to AWS Platforms
Module 3: AWS Products and Services Part 1
Module 4: AWS Products and Services Part 2
Module 5: Delivering Solutions using AWS
Module 6: AWS Resources
events.location: Cliftons, Level 11, Finexis Building, 108 Robinson Road, Singapore null

events.name: Hebocon Singapore (Robotics competition for the technically ungifted)
events.description: The search for Singapore's worst robot will take place some time this year (most likely in July 2015). Known as Japan’s "worst robot competition”, the purpose of the HEBOCON event is to find out which crappy robot is the ultimate failure of them all through a sumo-styled wrestling battle. Preparations are being made to bring this quirky robotic competition to Singapore. We are looking for venue hosts, sponsors, contributors and supporters for this inaugural event. More details about guidelines and rules of competition will be announced in March 2015. Meanwhile stay cute and unskillful! If you're interested to participate, please indicate your attendance here. Thank you. *the date indicated below is a tentative one. the confirmed schedule will be release in Mar 2015 For more information about HEBOCON, check out the official page at https://www.facebook.com/Hebocon.Official
events.location: TBD
